title: gcc@8.4.0 build broken (?)
body:
### Spack version
<!-- Add the output to the command below -->
```console
[kai@longhorn ~]$ spack --version
0.14.1-355-3aa225cd5
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install gcc@8.4.0
==> 141160: Installing gcc
==> Fetching https://ftpmirror.gnu.org/gcc/gcc-8.4.0/gcc-8.4.0.tar.xz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Staging archive: /tmp/kai/spack-stage/spack-stage-gcc-8.4.0-gvwvazjtvvm766l77e5od326olt3yslv/gcc-8.4.0.tar.xz
==> Created stage in /tmp/kai/spack-stage/spack-stage-gcc-8.4.0-gvwvazjtvvm766l77e5od326olt3yslv
1 out of 1 hunk FAILED -- saving rejects to file libsanitizer/sanitizer_common/sanitizer_platform_limits_posix.cc.rej
==> Patch /home/01537/kai/build/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/gcc/glibc-2.31-libsanitizer-1.patch failed.
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
    '/bin/patch' '-s' '-p' '1' '-i' '/home/01537/kai/build/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/gcc/glibc-2.31-libsanitizer-1.patch' '-d' '.'
==> Error: Failed to install gcc due to ChildError: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
    '/bin/patch' '-s' '-p' '1' '-i' '/home/01537/kai/build/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/gcc/glibc-2.31-libsanitizer-1.patch' '-d' '.'Traceback (most recent call l
```

### Platform and user environment

```console
[kai@longhorn ~]$ uname -a
Linux login2.longhorn.tacc.utexas.edu 4.14.0-115.10.1.el7a.ppc64le #1 SMP Wed Jun 26 09:32:17 UTC 2019 ppc64le ppc64le ppc64le GNU/Linux
[kai@longhorn ~]$ cat /etc/redhat-release
Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 7.6 (Maipo)
``` 

I haven't look into it, but it appears that the patch that comes with spack doesn't actually apply cleanly to the gcc it downloaded.
